Reviews.Title: Pretty good for the price you pay!
Reviews.Author: ranjith
Reviews.Content: When I decided to buy this TV, it was just as good as a gamble because I could not find many reviews online. I am glad that I went ahead and bought this TV because I feel that you cannot get anything better than this in the 200$ price range. I would go through the details of the TV, the brand and the things you have to know before buying this TV.Westinghouse TVs are said to be made by the Taiwanese LCD manufacturer Chimei which also makes LED/LCD panels for some other big players. It seems to have a good overall reputation. The package was basic and neat. It contained the TV, remote, AC/DC adapter, stand, power chord and the connecting screws. Setting it up took less than 5 minutes.The Picture and Sound qualities of this TV are really good for a basic LED TV. I wish the blacks were darker and clearer, the dark scenes are not as enjoyable as the bright ones. You can adjust the lighting in the room to fix this problem up to an extent.Update: The USB port is useless, it can be used only for servicing the TV!The connectivity options are pretty good too. This TV has a USB port even though I did not see that mentioned in any of the Tech Specs online. I did not check if it plays all video files as I use my Blu-Ray Player to connect the USB.Service and Warranty would be the deal breaker for Westinghouse TVs. If you face any problem with the TV, you will have to ship it back to their Texas facility to get a repair or replacement. This is rubbish as no one would want to spend 250$ to ship and get a 200$ TV repaired. Westinghouse should open service centers at least for each zone if they seriously want to stay ahead of the competition.To conclude, this TV is worth every penny you spend on it as long as you do not run into any troubles. If you do, it is going to be very difficult to get a repair or replacement unless you live in Texas :).Update: USB port is useless, it can be used only for servicing the TV per the manual.

Reviews.Title: Very nice TV
Reviews.Author: Weechella
Reviews.Content: Finally decided to upgrade from my old, monster Sony TV and I'm glad I did. The Westinghouse is just right for me.I'm not knowledgable about the fine points of picture and sound, but it does what it's supposed to and looks and sounds very good to me. Easy to set up right out of the box on my own (I'm a middle-aged female with good DIY skills). The on-screen guides are easy and intuitive to use.Now, for the wall-mount adventure and I'll be all set.

Reviews.Title: Functional with a few quirks
Reviews.Author: whackatak
Reviews.Content: This TV has a good number of inputs, is very thin, and has a good picture.However, after an exchange to verify it wasn't my unit specifically, I identified two flaws in this model of TV.  One, the volume is always too loud.  Having it on 1 or 2 is a reasonable listening level, and it is unbearable after about 20 (of 100).  Two, given the LED nature, there are 'hot spots' on the screen where the backlights are.  They are very obvious when the screen is on and black, and can create an inconsistent viewing experience when watching dark sources.If you can overlook those two (relatively minor) flaws (I couldn't), this is a good TV for the price!

Reviews.Title: decent quality and super efficient!
Reviews.Author: Joe Glines
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV in June 2012 and use it everyday.  While on solid black I can see a little light coloring around the edges, it is negligible.  I was really into saving $ on electricity so I hooked it up to my power meeter and, on the power-saving setting, it was drawing about the same as a 30-watt bulb!  Wow!My biggest gripe is that there aren't a lot of connection options. I wish it had more HDMI and RCA inputs.

Reviews.Title: Buyer Beware
Reviews.Author: Anne E.
Reviews.Content: I purchased this model at Costco in 2011 for a spare bedroom and the T.V has had less than 40 hours use in 2 years.The picture quality was good but the sound quality was awful.Last week it went out and will not turn back on.After Googling this model and locating the consumer affairs website, it seems this is a common problem with this model in particular and Westinghouse T.V's in general.The reviews on consumer affairs website indicate the customer service at Westinghouse is non-existent and trying to resolve issues with these T.V's is beyond difficult and frustrating.Even purchasing the additional Costco 2 year warranty has only brought offers from Westinghouse to replace with a reconditioned model and the shipping to return the broken T.V can run as much as $100.00 and people have had to call and keep calling numerous times and often been mislead with information on the status of their return.It looks like such a headache to get any customer service or resolution from Westinghouse that I am most likely going to put it in the garbage and do better research on the next brand that I buy.

Reviews.Title: great
Reviews.Author: Julian
Reviews.Content: had this for about 4months now. not a single problem. not sure what all the moaning abouts! coolool cool col

Reviews.Title: Last about 1 1/2 years then picture flickers!
Reviews.Author: Mark Garcia
Reviews.Content: Tv looks and sounds great, and was under $300, but just like another buyer, it started flickering every once in a while, and now it's every 30 seconds making it impossible to watch anything.

Reviews.Title: Rebate problem
Reviews.Author: LOVE MY KINDLE
Reviews.Content: I just bought an LD-3265 HDTV from Tiger Direct. There was supposed to be a $40 rebate. The Tiger Direct guy said that the rebate form was on the Westinghouse website, but I have not been able to find it. It appears that Westinghouse doesn't know they are supposed to be giving a rebate on this TV. Be careful with both Westinghouse and Tiger Direct!

Reviews.Title: HDMI CABLE
Reviews.Author: Jo-Ann
Reviews.Content: bought it and so far i'ts great! I had to buy a HDMI cable as I couldn't get any channels without it and i have CenturyLink tv.

Reviews.Title: Excellent purchase
Reviews.Author: bjono
Reviews.Content: So far this tv is working great, no complaints with this purchase. I would recommend this brand any day. Easy to set up.

Reviews.Title: Sucky - LED LCD
Reviews.Author: Matt
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV almost a year ago to the date, and about three months ago it started to have an intermitent flickering in the picture.  At first I thought it was the cable box, but then it also did the flickering when we watched DVD's on it.  Now it's pretty much non-stop flickering, and I am trying to deal with Westinghouse with regards to the 1 year manufacturer warranty.  I Paid 263.99 for the unit at HHgregg, and thought I was getting a deal.  Westinghouse needs to stick to making appliances.....Digital division sucks! Do not by this unit, go to consumer compaliants on LD-3235, and start to read..I wish I had!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Doesn't display 16:9 aspect ratio properly - picture stretched
Reviews.Author: Zoran Lazarevic
Reviews.Content: The TV picture is stretched out, but TV works. It is slow to turn on.This TV doesn't display 16:9 aspect ratio properly. Initially I thought that my cable box is broken, but later I connected it to my PC and the image was stretched out horizontally. I spent an hour in TV menu adjusting settings. Some people don't care about aspect ratio, but it bothers me a lot. It is amazing that Westinghouse can't display the picture correctly - that is the basic purpose of a TV set.

Reviews.Title: Westinghouse does not stand by product.
Reviews.Author: scoob
Reviews.Content: Bought a tv on Black Friday from Westinghouse. TV defective. Westinghouse will not stand by warranty. Product is subpar. Customer service ineffective.
